summary: Official statement from the U.S. Attorney's Office for the Southern District of New York announcing the death of Jeffrey Epstein by apparent suicide in his jail cell. The statement confirms the ongoing investigation into sex trafficking charges and urges victims to come forward.

persons.name: Geoffrey S. Berman
persons.context: Issued the official statement on behalf of the U.S. Attorney's Office regarding Epstein's death and the ongoing investigation.

persons.name: Jeffrey Epstein
persons.context: The accused sex trafficker who was found dead in his cell at the Manhattan Correctional Center, with his death ruled an apparent suicide.

connections.description: Berman, as the U.S. Attorney, was the lead prosecutor overseeing the federal sex trafficking case against Epstein.

events.title: Death of Jeffrey Epstein
events.description: Jeffrey Epstein was found unresponsive in his cell at the Manhattan Correctional Center and pronounced dead shortly thereafter of an apparent suicide.

keyFacts: Jeffrey Epstein died by apparent suicide in his jail cell at the Manhattan Correctional Center on August 10, 2019.
The U.S. Attorney's Office stated that Epstein's death presented a potential hurdle to giving his victims their day in court.
The federal investigation into the sex trafficking charges, including a conspiracy count, was stated to be ongoing despite Epstein's death.
The statement urged other potential victims or individuals with information to come forward and contact the authorities.
